alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 1:49PM CDT until June 09 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County. Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls affecting Chase County. Cottonwood River near Plymouth affecting Lyon and Chase Counties. For the Cottonwood River...including Florence, Cottonwood Falls, Plymouth...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Highway 177 floods between Strong City and Cottonwood Falls. Flood waters spread out on the south side of Strong City impacting First Street and crossing over Highway 177. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:50 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Cottonwood River Cottonwood Fall 9.0 8.4 Sun 8 am CDT 13.0 11.8 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
